content.title: Trademark Reimbursement Scheme
content.department: Department of Information Technology, Electronics and Communications
content.details: The scheme 'Trademark Reimbursement Scheme' is a scheme by the Department of Information Technology, Electronics and Communications, Government of Goa, for the Startups of Goa. The scheme is a part of the Start-up Policy 2017. For start-ups that have successfully entered the production/service delivery phase, and want to trademark their company name and logo, 50% of the cost of trade-mark registration of their company name and logo will be reimbursed up to ₹ 25,000/-.
benefits: 50% reimbursement of trademark registration costs up to ₹ 25,000/-
Up to 200 applicants can avail benefits per year
Disbursal within 60 days of application approval
eligibility: The applicant should be a startup certified by the Startup Promotion Cell (SPC)
The applicant should have a valid start-up certificate number
The startup must have successfully registered its trademark
documents_required: The form and documents as mentioned in Annexure 1

faqs.question: Can start-ups apply for this scheme if they have not yet entered the production/service delivery phase?
faqs.answer: No, this scheme is specifically for start-ups that have successfully entered the production/service delivery phase.

faqs.question: Is there a limit to the number of times a start-up can reapply for this scheme if rejected?
faqs.answer: There is no specific limit to reapplications, but each application should meet the scheme's criteria.

faqs.question: Is there a specific time window for submitting the application each year?
faqs.answer: Applicants can apply at any time during the financial year but only within 6 months of incurring the relevant expenditure.

faqs.question: Can start-ups in any industry or sector apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Start-ups from various industries or sectors can apply as long as they meet the scheme's eligibility criteria.

faqs.question: Can the reimbursement amount exceed the actual cost of trademark registration?
faqs.answer: No, the reimbursement amount is capped at 50% of the actual cost or INR 25,000, whichever is lower.

faqs.question: Is there a specific authority responsible for trademark registration in Goa?
faqs.answer: Trademark registration is typically handled by the Controller General of Patents, Designs, and Trademarks.

faqs.question: Can start-ups trademark their company name and logo independently, or must it be done together?
faqs.answer: Start-ups can trademark their company name and logo independently under this scheme.

faqs.question: How does this scheme benefit start-ups in the long term?
faqs.answer: By providing reimbursement for trademark registration, the scheme helps start-ups protect their brand identity, which is crucial for long-term success.

faqs.question: Can start-ups apply for trademark registration for products and services other than their company name and logo under this scheme?
faqs.answer: This scheme specifically covers the trademark registration of the company name and logo, not other products or services.

faqs.question: Are there any fees associated with applying for this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there are no application fees associated with applying for this scheme.

faqs.question: Can start-ups apply for this scheme retroactively for trademark registration expenses?
faqs.answer: No, only expenses incurred after the notification of Goa Start-up Policy 2017 are considered for reimbursement.

faqs.question: When can the approved amount be expected to be disbursed?
faqs.answer: Approved amounts are disbursed within 60 days from the date of approval.

faqs.question: What is the timeframe for eligible expenditure to be considered for reimbursement?
faqs.answer: Eligible expenditure must be incurred after the notification of Goa Start-up Policy 2017, within its validity, and paid digitally.

faqs.question: Are the benefits guaranteed for all eligible start-ups?
faqs.answer: No, the benefits are not guaranteed; the SPC reserves the right to accept or reject applications.
